translation: When he (the Yogi) feels that infinite bliss which can be grasped by the pure intellect and which transcends the senses, and is established therein, never moving away from the reality.
commentary: 6.21 happiness bliss? The ultimate infinite? that which? That that? Buddhigrahya that which can be grasped by reason? transcending the senses? Vetti knows? where where? Not not? f and? Eve even? This is this? established established? Moving moves? Essentially from the Reality.Commentary The Infinite Bliss of the Self (which is beyond the reach of the senses) can be grasped (realized) by the pure intellect
